name: GetRoleTargetsByUserAndRole
description:
Retrieve role targets for a user's specific role.

This tool retrieves all role targets assigned to a specific user with a given role in Okta. It is useful for identifying which applications or groups a user with a certain administrative role can manage. If there are no specific targets, an empty list is returned.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of an existing Okta user to retrieve role targets for, required for identifying the user within Okta.

value_schema.description: ID of an existing Okta user

parameters.name: role_id_or_encoded_role_name
parameters.description: The ID of the role or its Base32 encoded name to specify which role's targets to retrieve.

value_schema.description: The `id` of the role or Base32 encoded `id` of the role name

parameters.name: user_assignment_type
parameters.description: Specifies the assignment type of the user, either 'USER' or 'GROUP'.

value_schema.description: Specifies the assignment type of the user

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: The opaque string used for pagination, indicating your current position in the list, obtained from the `Link` response header.

value_schema.description: The cursor to use for pagination. It is an opaque string that specifies your current location in the list and is obtained from the `Link` response header. See [Pagination](https://developer.okta.com/docs/api/#pagination).

parameters.name: object_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of role targets to return.

value_schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to return
